Author: Vertigo#0439
Content: Noob question is native wallet any safer than fast?

Author: Vertigo#0439
Content: Than fast wallet

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: Both wallets are equally safe , it depends on which one fits you better, if you want a fast approach entering your wallet will recommend Lite mode it doesn't need to load the complete blockchain but still I think every user should always read the precautions of this mode. For instance before sending any type of transaction to the wallet the best practice is to get a pin password for the wallet and most importantly save your seed and verify you wrote it right by entering the wallet with it at least 3 times and finally but not least important saving your private key generated for your specific address depeding on the coin you are using. Here is a good start to learn more about how Agama Lite mode and Native work. Here is a guide for you see regarding lite mode. in a video https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000024481-how-to-install-agama-windows-

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: And also here is a little article regarding the difference each mode https://support.komodoplatform.com/solution/articles/29000024425-difference-between-native-and-lite-mode

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: I am not suggesting that one is safer than the other because in native mode you have all of your private keys stored in your computer and as long as your computer is working and have your files intact you won't loose your funds an even though if that happen you can always save your private keys of the addresses that hold your assets as back up or the wallet.dat file . The only way  that it could problematic for native or  lite mode  is if your computer or  enviorment gets compromised  ... so is a matter of choosing what fits you best at the end

Content:
Hey @Hermes  I appreciate your assistance yesterday, but I still couldn't connect to the Agama v0.2.41d wallet on KMD Native mode. Tried to delete chainstate, blocks, peers.dat, and restart and it didnt work. I was unable to see the komododod or komodoconf (I forget what the name of the background process is) in the task manager. 

Is there anything else I can try at this point? I have searched through all the guides pertaining to this issue online and haven't . I am nervous about my KMD holdings

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: You already checked if any Antivirus or Firewall could be blocking komodod process?

Author: sir#6225
Content: Yes, I disabled all AV

Author: sir#6225
Content: I have had no issues connecting to Native for over 9 months

Author: sir#6225
Content: I just bought a new laptop, is there anyway I can try to " import" the wallet.dat and run KMD on native on the new machine

Author: Hermes#6934
Content: go again to www.komodoplatform.com and download the new version of the wallet 2.42.c  , and also if you can please send me a screnshot of the error, if you are going to use a new machine the only thing that you need to do is storing the wallet.dat file in the userdata or %appdata%Roaming/Komodo Folder in the machine and when you run the native mode it will recognize the wallet.dat and show tour addressses. Do this only when Agama is shut down .

Author: mikeey89#0543
Content:
Hi! I have some questions regarding BarterDex and Hyperdex on Komodo. 
1. Do you support order books?
2. Do you support market-orders?
3. Do you support limit orders?

Author: mikeey89#0543
Content: 4. Why is my order books empty on both platforms?

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: order books/market orders  will be displayed in some time, where bids and asks will be updated,

Author: Nabob#5004
Content: limit orders/ good till cancelled  orders are live untill users cancelled or  order maches. this feature is default  on hyperdex

Author: mikeey89#0543
Content: Why is mine empty on all pairs?

Author: Nabob#5004
Content:
barterDEX/hyperdex uses a broadcast protocol so all nodes know about all offers in realtime.
it is broadcast to all that are online (via redundant relay nodes whose sole purpose is to relay orders)
